alert.note: Alert for Labette; Montgomery (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 10:41AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Labette and Montgomery Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1040 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Mccune to near Mound Valley to 6 miles southwest of Independence. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Cherryvale, Oswego, Chetopa, Altamont, Edna, Dearing, Mound Valley, Liberty, Bolton, Sycamore, Bartlett, Labette, Parsons Tri City Airport, Angola, Dennis, Elk City Lake, and Big Hill Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
